author: Alex Jr. "Bacalao21"

review: The Chromecast is truly a valuable and genuine alternative to a lot of other set-top boxes (ie. Apple TV, Roku, etc.)The requirements to utilize a Chromecast to it's fullest extent?-A decent wireless network, that the Chromecast can connect to (cannot have a authentication portal.. at least not that I'm aware of)-A device that supports said wireless streaming-USB power.-USB power, I plugged this guy into a normal, older 32" TV that supports a USB, but is actually a factory service port- so it won't supply a consistent 5V. I solved this by utilizing a USB portable charger I had laying around- but pair this with a normal USB wall plug, problem solved.-A decent wireless network, should support a decent amount of bandwidth going through from device to Chromecast, for HD and SD.-A device that supports said wireless streaming.Safari/Chrome on the iPad, will not stream.The YouTube, Pandora app on the iPad, will.Chrome on the MacBook, Desktop, or any laptop, will if you download the Chromecast extension.The best thing I did for this Chromecast, was purchasing Plex Media Player.My desktop has a ton of Movies, TV Shows and is usually always running.With the mobile app, desktop browser, I basically have my own Netflix- free, given I can find the shows I like.

Ill keep it now.Beams Pandora and YouTube with little lag/buffer and Netflix with a longer lag/buffer, but it did work.
